source.name: Law Enforcement Management and Administrative Statistics (LEMAS), 2000
source.description: This survey, the sixth in the Bureau of Justice Statistics Law Enforcement Management and Administrative Statistics (LEMAS) program, presents information on general purpose state and local law enforcement agencies, including state police, county police, municipal police, and sheriff's offices. Variables include size of the population served; type, number, and demographic characteristics of employees; operating budget; agency functions; type of equipment used; use of computer and information systems; salary ranges for officers; policies and programs; and other matters related to management, operations, and personnel.  As of 2000, special police agencies such as transit, airport, or campus police are no longer included in this file.
